page.title: 06Houses and Buildings in Ince
page.content: In Lower Ince many buildings have been demolished. Most of the houses that are left are old and neglected. Vandals often break into the empty houses and start fires. However the council is now building some new homes for old people. It is also planting flowers and trees around the houses to help make the area more pleasant for the residents. Near to the reclaimed site of the old Lower Ince Railway Station there is a small grassy play-ground but someone has bro- ken the swings and the rocking horse. Only the climbing frame and slide are now left. Even the trees have been vandalised. One of the more attractive buildings in Ince is the former Town Hall. It is typically Edwardian, built in 1903 in the Romanesque style with red brick and lots of ornate terra- cotta decoration. The Town Hall is now a District Office for Wigan Metro.
